Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

GraphPanel

public GraphPanel(Node graphRoot,
                  java.util.Set<Node.Kind> restriction)
Creates the panel displaying the graph restricted to a given set of cells. The root is explicitely given

Parameters:
graphRoot - the root of the graph
restriction - the set of node kinds to display or null if everything is shown.
Method Detail

getToolTipText

public java.lang.String getToolTipText(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event)
Overrides:
getToolTipText in class org.jgraph.JGraph

update

public void update(Node node)
Specified by:
update in interface TrackerListener

printDot

private void printDot(java.io.PrintStream out,
                      Node root,
                      java.util.Set<Node.Kind> restriction)
Prints a raw dot file for placement. There is no labels as we are only interested in node placement.

Parameters:
out - The stream on which to print the dot file (usually a pipe).
root - The root of the graph
restriction - A set of kinds restricting the nodes that will be displayed (placement and display must use the same set).

edge

public static java.lang.Long edge(int src,
                                  int dst)
Computes a unique id as a long for an edge using the id of the source and destination

Parameters:
src - the id of the source node,
dst - the id of the destination node.
Returns:
a long.

parseDot

private void parseDot(java.io.BufferedReader in)
Parses the output of a dot file processed with plain option. It extracts the placement of nodes and set the graph accordingly.

Parameters:
in - The stream to read the result file from.

doPlacement

private void doPlacement()
This method performs the placement of the nodes of the graph. It uses dot internally.
